hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via ETH/BTC Breakout Leading Spot
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime for BTC, a decisive breakout in the ETH/BTC ratio (3-day close above its 50-day SMA after trading below for >15 days) will lead the spot market, predicting a transition to a BULL regime for BTC within 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: ETH/BTC is a key risk-on indicator. Its sustained breakout from underperformance suggests capital rotation into higher-beta crypto assets, which often precedes broad market bullish momentum and a regime shift. ETH leading in volume confirms the move.
entry_conditions: ETH/BTC ratio has been below its 50-day SMA for >15 consecutive days
ETH/BTC ratio has a 3-day closing price > its 50-day SMA
ETH spot volume on breakout day > BTC spot volume (USD)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC regime indicator flips to BULL
exit_conditions.stop_loss: ETH/BTC ratio closes back below its 50-day SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days after entry without a BTC regime flip to BULL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: ETH/BTC breakouts occur but are not followed by a BTC regime transition to BULL within the specified window more than 60% of the time.
